name: GatorMail SmartForms
author: GatorMail

sections.description:
Smart Forms – Superior web capture deployment. A GatorMail Smart Form that can be used on multiple website pages.
You can apply unique rules and actions to each, all within a single form.

[https://www.communigator.co.uk/email-marketing-software/] (https://www.communigator.co.uk/email-marketing-software/)
sections.installation:
1. Upload GatorMail Smart Forms plugin to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress.
  3. Go to the GatorMail Smart Forms panel under the ‘Settings’ menu and add your Smart Forms required settings.
sections.changelog:
1.0.0

First release version.

1.1.0

Added support for async and defer attributes.

short_description: Embeds the GatorMail Smart Forms script into your Wordpress.  Add shortcodes to your Wordpress content to render your GatorMail Smart Forms.
description:
Smart Forms – Superior web capture deployment. A GatorMail Smart Form that can be used on multiple website pages.
You can apply unique rules and actions to each, all within a single form.

[https://www.communigator.co.uk/email-marketing-software/] (https://www.communigator.co.uk/email-marketing-software/)

screenshots.caption: Hover over the Settings menu on the left and you should see "GatorMail Smart Forms". Click on this menu item.
Go to your GatorMail instance and into any html Smart Form. Click on the Wordpress Pluggin Settings tab.
In Wordpress enter the Instance name and the Smart Form Id in the GatorMail Smart Form settings.

When setup in WordPress add the [gatormailsmartform id="{exampleid}"] shortcode to your Wordpress content to display the smart form. You can get the shortcode from your GatorMail instance in your Wordpress Plugging setting tab.
